comments.body: @jipanyang @stcheng  I guess the memory leak bug is due to the reallocation of link cache when interface name cannot be resolved. Is this bug first introduced on https://github.com/Azure/sonic-swss/commit/142673ad6cddf37286ab097c982b31f25c61358c#diff-4a3ea7752832ebd49f989cc95ae042e1?

latestReviews.body: Could you check https://github.com/Azure/sonic-swss-common/blob/master/common/linkcache.cpp ? It might be more efficient to allocate cache once and reuse it with nl_cache_refill().

reviews.body: Could you check https://github.com/Azure/sonic-swss-common/blob/master/common/linkcache.cpp ? It might be more efficient to allocate cache once and reuse it with nl_cache_refill().

comments.body: @jipanyang to review.
retest this please
you could remove the extra empty trailing spaces as well

This change causes fpmsyncd being OOM killed all the time on vsonic testbed.

Further check shows the problem was firs introduced with https://github.com/Azure/sonic-swss/pull/772 
https://github.com/Azure/sonic-swss/commit/52de963fe817dbb0b43f724a901fee22a87e36a5#diff-4a3ea7752832ebd49f989cc95ae042e1R279

Now bool RouteSync::getIfName(int if_index, char *if_name, size_t name_len)  is used for regular route too, it has netlink memory leak.


@jipanyang I am fixing it now. You can check the PR https://github.com/Azure/sonic-swss/pull/864
Did you build with and without optimization turned on? Do you need to change any caller?

@yxieca Yes, I built with SONIC_PROFILING_ON=y and without this option.
The caller is in fpmsyncd.cpp code and it uses default port number https://github.com/Azure/sonic-swss/blob/master/fpmsyncd/fpmsyncd.cpp#L36
I see. the caller is always using the default value :-)
Updated with new design

TODO:
1. will update the unit test both both Broadcom and Mellanox scenarios
2. will remove deprecated code in swss for virtual switch platform

DONE

Hi lguohan, according to your suggestion, I created this PR separately for pfc-wd, please take a moment to deal with it, thanks.
@lguohan @shine4chen
Does it pass the pfcwd test in mgmt. repo?

Hi wendani, thanks for your reminder, I have updated the corresponding channel name from 'PFC_WD' to 'PFC_WD_ACTION'. In addition, regarding 'pfcwd test in mgmt. repo', our mgmt.repo environment does not support pfcwd test temporarily. However, the pfc-wd function tested in mgmt.repo, we have performed corresponding manual tests in our own environment, and have passed.
@wendani
retest this please

reviews.body: We must have the changes in VxlanOrch.h (Line 140 and 201)  to have the separator as `: `instead of `|`

comments.body: There are some failures for the Vnet bitmap test, can you check?

There are failures because implementation of "bitmap VNET" is not merged yet and also it depends on some other PRs.
In PR description there is a list of PRs that should be merged first:
> Depends on the following PRs:
>* #773
>* [Azure/sonic-buildimage#2571](https://github.com/Azure/sonic-buildimage/pull/2571)
>* [Azure/sonic-sairedis#424](https://github.com/Azure/sonic-sairedis/pull/424)
